data.headline: S&P 500, Dow, Nasdaq 100, and Russell 2000 futures all edge lower, reversing a three-day S&P 500 win streak.
bullets: Fed minutes signal a divided, hawkish stance, curbing hopes for near-term rate cuts.
AI sector faces renewed valuation, spending, and disruption worries, dampening risk appetite.
Oil prices jump to multi-month highs on escalating US-Iran tensions, boosting energy stocks and nudging gold higher.
Walmart drops premarket after modest beats but cautious Q1 and FY2027 EPS guidance below consensus.
DoorDash surges on strong Q4 order growth and an upbeat outlook.
Traders monitor moves in Hims & Hers, Carvana, Figma, and Blue Owl after a private-credit fund redemption halt.
Focus remains on upcoming wholesale inventories, labor, and housing data, as well as earnings from Southern Co for intraday direction.
